headline: Chewy Peanut Butter Brownies
description: These peanut butter brownies are an irresistible favorite, so you might as well double the recipe when you make them. Try with chocolate frosting.
name: Chewy Peanut Butter Brownies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C ). Grease a 9x9-inch baking pan.
Cream together peanut butter and margarine in a medium bowl. Gradually blend in white sugar, brown sugar, eggs, and vanilla; mix until fluffy.
Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a separate bowl. Stir into the peanut butter mixture until well blended.
Bake in the preheated oven until the top springs back when touched, 30 to 35 minutes. Cool and cut into 16 squares.

review.reviewBody: Awesome loved it quick and easy .
it was tasty
These really were delicious. I followed the recipe exactly. Will make them again.
Just added chocolate chips

I've been using this recipe for years, and they always turn out perfect. I add 1/3 cup of cocoa powder to make them more chocolate-y. It also lends very nicely to vegan baking; just substitute half a mashed banana for each egg. The chocolate + banana + peanut butter compliment each other nicely.
They are SO good and super moist. I‚Äôll make them again and again!
I made this recipe "exactly" as presented. I only cooked it for 30 minutes (yes, my oven is spot on) and they were very "overdone". Also, I would never call this a brownie - more like a cookie.
Perfect, decreased salt by half, delicious and satisfied the food cravings that I had.
So easy to make and so good
These brownies are awesome!! I added a little bit more peanut butter. Also, my oven took 10 extra minutes to cook. I will definitely make again!
Loved this recipe. I followed the tip to stir ingredients by hand to make the brownies fudgey I also only baked 28 minutes. They were perfect. I will definitely make again.

I love this recipe! Very easy to make, I changed it up a little and added white chocolate chips to the batter, (because I had some extra) üòä and I didn‚Äôt have vanilla, but was happy to find out you can sub honey for vanilla, I had alfalfa honey (local). Very good and chewy brownie.
Only problem is .. it didn't hold together. It was very crumbly like.
This is my husband's favorite. He likes this better than chocolate brownies!
Could not taste the peanut butter. Next time will drizzle some on top. Consistency was great though.
I love it and so does everyone who eats it! Yummy!!!

Great recipe! Used others advice, so to make more brownie texture, deleted 1 egg, and reduced flour by 1/8 cup. I also increased the peanut butter to 3/4 cups, and reduced the butter to 1/4 cup. I baked them on 325 for 25 minutes, then turned oven off and left them in an additional 5 minutes & they turned out fantastic! I thought I'd want to add chocolate icing, but they actually are great "as is"!

After reading other reviews stating how cake-like these come out, I decided to alter the mixing instructions. I kept the ingredients the same except to add 1/2 cup of dry roasted peanuts. I added all the dry ingredients to my stand mixer and mixed. Then I added all of the wet ingredients and mixed just until combined. I baked at 350 for about 32 minutes and they came out with the chewy brownie-like texture that I prefer. They were a hit, so I consider this a keeper!
10/10 I added a thin layer of melted peanut butter, honey, and brown sugar to the top of the chewy brownies They don‚Äôt look done but they are which is weird
I changed the white sugar to splenda and doubled the recipe. Then I only cooked it 20 minutes and they are perfect.
Delicious!!!, used Lily's salted caramel baking chips, will definitely make again!!!
My favorite brownies!!
It's very delicious
These are absolutely delicious!
A baked dessert that actually turned out alright. Was good.

This came out really great, on the chewy part as well. This is considering I accidently left out 1/4 cup of the white sugar. Still incredibly sweet and delicious, made some whipped cream for it as well. Ended up taking it out at 20 minutes instead of 30, the top had browned considerably, it did spring back like the recipe described, and the butter knife came out clean. Let it cool for about 1 hour 10 minutes, mostly because I forgot about it. Discovered it was cooked perfectly fine, bottom browned, no undercooked bits. I also sprinkled some dark chocolate bits on the top before I put it in. I'll be honest and say they aren't as dense as the classic chocolate brownies, or as chewy. But they're still definitely a brownie, worth a try as all the ingredients are very easy to come across. 
Instead of just greasing the bottom, I greased it and then put some parchment paper down into it, then greased the paper as well, just so it absolutely wouldn't stick, and so it'd come out of the pan. I used a 9 by 9 square metal baking pan for this.
This was a good, easy to follow recipe. I added semisweet chocolate chips. These were cake that fudgy and I prefer fudgy. That's the only reason I gave it 4 stars.
Yummy
Really good
Definitely make again. I put homemade chocolate frosting on mine. Brownies need frosting!
Simple recipe but a little messy

These were very easy and very good. I followed the recipe but did add some chocolate chips to the batter. Mine took several minutes longer to bake and were still very soft inside. I suspect that is because the natural peanut butter I used is more ‚Äúdrippy‚Äù than other brands.
Delicious!
Great recipe! The peanut butter taste isn‚Äôt too strong so I would suggest doing 2/3 a cup of peanut butter instead of 1/2
These were a hit! I made these for my son‚Äôs birthday. I added a half cup of mini semi sweet chocolate chips.
It was ok but a couple people thought it didn‚Äôt have much a of peanut butter flavor.

I made according to the recipe. These are very "moist and fudgy" in the center at 30 min. The peanut butter is not overpowering at all. definitely would cover the edges with foil at 15 min. into cooking because they get crispy. The more you mix the eggs, the more cakey they will be.
I made a double batch and thought they tasted very good.

So delicious! I made these for the first time and my whole family said *make these again" and "this recipe is a keeper. " I added just a bit more peanut butter for extra peanuty taste, and combined crunchy and honey peanut butters. They turned out thick and perfectly chewy, just like a brownie. Outstanding!!

Deliciously chewy and satisfying. I made a few changes. I used butter instead of margarine. I reversed the sugars (2/3 cup brown sugar) and reduced the granulated sugar to 1/3 cup. I used white whole wheat flour. Then I threw in 1/2 cup chocolate chips...just because!
Very good, baked for 25 minutes and it turned out perfectly
I added mini chocolate chips.
Mmmmmmmmmmmmm
Yummy. I love a bar cookie. I used Reese peanut butter and I added 1/4 C chocolate chips,lightly dusted with flour so they don‚Äôt sink to the bottom. Yuck and easy.
Excellent! These are easy to make and turned out great.

I am making these for the second time. They are DELICIOUS!!!! Only change was substitute butter for the margarine and sprinkle with bittersweet chocolate chips. Yummy! Make these you will not
 be sorry.
I used butter not margarine and used half the amount of sugar. Also baked it in a mini muffin pan. They came out great!
Easy and super delicious!
Fantastic!!!! We added some butterscotch chips and my family went crazy for them! Yum!!!
Easy and delicious made to the recipe specifications.

Easy to make...tasted delicious but will never replace chocolate brownies....shared with my neighbor...she said the same...I melted some dark chocolate to put on top...made them more yummy...simple simple simple
They are so easy to make and awesome.

I usually make chocolate brownies, thought I'd try these for a change, I'm ssssooooo glad that I did. These are just so amazing, you can't put into words. 
 My new favourite. 
Thank you

out of this 
world good
The family loved this recipe. Definitely a keeper! I substituted butter for the margarine and I added 2 cups of mini chocolate chips. If I used regular sized chips I would have added 1 or less cups.

The brownies turned out good, I used butter instead of margarine. I would like to try it with margarine next time to see if they turn out a little fluffier. I only baked them for 27 min based on the reviews I read, so they were chewy and not cakey... I will make them again.

Here are the changes I made that resulted in PERFECT brownies:
3/4 c pb
5 T butter
1/3 c granulated sugar
1/2 c packed brown sugar plus 1/3 c "loosely" packed
1 egg plus 1 yolk both at room temp 
1/2 t vanilla
3/4 c flour
1/2 t baking powder
pinch salt
I also added a cup of peanut butter chips.
I mixed everything by hand to avoid over mixing. I greased an 8 x 8 pan and then lined it with parchment paper.
I baked them at 350 for 25 minutes but went 2 minutes longer. Watch closely. They firm up as they cool.
These were delicious! I'm extremely fussy with my brownies and while I've changed the amounts from the original the bones of the original are there and it's a great base recipe.
 No topping is needed but for this first time I melted a cup of pb and chocolate chips.
Next time I'm leaving them bare. They are so good. I may try them with chocolate chips vs peanut butter chips just for fun.
Turned out great. I added chocolate frosting (from the Best Brownies recipe) and they were all eaten up by the next day.
It was gone so fast, I didnt get a chance to take a picture. But it was delicious! Everyone loved it. I followed the recipe exactly and it was rich and moist. I will be making it again soon
OMgosh made this for my mother-in-laws Birthday, WONDERFUL and super easy
Taste like baking powder.
came out great. thank you
Great recipe. Even goes with crunchy PB!

I used crunchy peanut butter because that‚Äôs what I had, these were DELICIOUS! Soft and chewy! Also I sprinkled about 1/4 bag chocolate chips on the top when I took them out of the oven, let them melt and gently spread the chocolate over the top of the bars. Great recipe, thanks!!
The first time I made these, I threw out my old standby peanut butter bar recipe - these are soooooo much better! Thank you for sharing.

This is a five-star recipe for sure! Made EXACTLY as directed in an 8x8 square pan and baked for about 33 minutes. The bars came out PERFECTLY. Chewy and moist and flavorful without being overpowering. Hubby would have rated this a 10/5 if he could. I don't even really care for peanut butter and I couldn't stop eating these bars! Make the recipe, folks, stop with all your tweaks and substitutions! The recipe is perfect as it is!

Sometimes when I make these they turn out perfectly and are delicious. Fluffy and soft on the inside with that peanut butter flavor I love and slightly crispy on the outside. Sometimes, however, for some reason they just don't bake through and I'm forced to over-bake them in order to get the inside fully cooked. Not sure why this happens sometimes. It could be my mistake, but for the most part, I love this recipe.
Made these for a 2nd time but added butterscotch chips. So easy and delicious.
Try making these in mini muffin tins. I topped with a chocolate ganache and sprinkled with peanut butter chips. AWESOME!!
Made these with my grandson triple the batch for Thanksgiving dinner for family and friends turned out fantastic simple but fun to make
My daughter liked it to me it was two dry so if I decide to make it again I will probably add more liquid are less baking time

It was really delicious, my friends loved it. I am only 17 but am looking forward to one day opening my own bakery but I will not use this recipe because it is someone else's and they deserve the credit.

I made this with 1 C of peanut butter and it turned out well. It's not chewy in the slightest, it's quite light/airy/cakey for a brownie recipe. Still tastes good. Good way to use up peanut butter. 

--- EDIT --- It is now the day after I made this recipe, and it has now become chewy with a dense brownie-like texture. I take back what I said in my original review. So my tip is: WAIT 24 hours to eat this because it magically changes and becomes better overnight.

Amazing! If you love peanut butter you will love these! Some peanut butter recipes don‚Äôt taste much like peanut butter once it‚Äôs baked but there are wonderful! Definitely need a big glass of milk!
loved these. Way better than chocolate brownies! Thanks!
Easy recipe.

Amazing recipe. My kids inhaled these and begged me to make a second tray. Would give this 10 stars. Only change I made was using 1/2 creamy and 1/2 chunky peanut butter in an 8x8 pan. So thick and chewy like a brownie but they tasted like super soft peanut butter cookies. Delicious!

Made as directed with the addition of mini chocolate chips; approx
 3/4 c. They are scrumptious

Doubled it in a 9x13. just took out one egg and made as is. Baked a bit longer.
Topped with reeses chips - next time top with chocolate chips too. Yum!
Delicious! I don‚Äôt even think you need frosting!
Really good recipe, just make sure not to over bake it. No frosting need! Great alternative to chocolate brownies or peanut butter cookies.

Used to eat these in elementary school for breakfast (before schools paid attention to peanut allergies). The school chef (she was chef worthy) would always put cream cheese frosting on them, basically my favorite time of the day was eating these peanut butter bars before school started! Thank you for sharing, I have made several times already and my kids love them too!

I definitely did something wrong. Everything was all mixed but the batter was more like cookie dough, I added an extra egg and some honey, but it didn't do much. I couldn't even pour it, it was so thick. It's in the oven now, I'm hoping the heat will spread it out. It was just a big blob in the middle of the pan. Anyone know why?? I was so excited for this!!
These are a family favorite!!! I make them like mini muffins and put peanut butter chips in them. They are so moist and flavorful...a peanut butter lovers delight!!!
I will be making it again but I might add chocolate chips or bananas.
I loved these brownies! I made it in an 8 x 8 pan because that is what I have. I added some chocolate chips. Delicious. I will be making these again!

Delicious! I did double the recipe & took the advice of a reviewer when doubling the recipe to use one less egg, 1/3 cup less flour & a dollop more of peanut butter. After stirring everything together, I used an electric handheld mixer for about 20 seconds to make sure the ingredients were well incorporated. The batter was creamy & spread easily into the 9x13 glass dish. I baked for 30 minutes & the center was still very jiggly. I laid aluminum foil over dish to prevent over- browning & had to bake for 10-15 more minutes (just keep checking for a non- jiggly center- then they're done) I waited 15 minutes for them to cool some & then frosted with a simple chocolate frosting: 1/2 stick melted butter, 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 cup sifted confectioners sugar, 1/8- 1/4 cup milk, 1/2 tsp vanilla extract (mix with electric hand mixer until smooth). 
They were chewy and absolutely delicious. Huge hit with my dinner party!
Added milk chocolate chops. 1/2 cup. Awesome recipe.
PB brownies are usually dry and tasteless, but these were not! Very chewy and moist. I will make them again. Cover halfway through with foil so the edges don't get too brown.
I'm just a beginner at baking, I made this and took it to a family gathering and everyone loved them. They all got eaten up.

A new family favorite and a real keeper. The second time I used Crisco butter fLavor bar in place of margarine and 2 tsp of baking soda. I also added Reese‚Äôs Pieces. When baking, I covered 1 ‚Äú in from edge with foil (not touching batter) and they came out light and chewy. Scrumptious!
I doubled the recipe, used 3 eggs and added mini-chocolate chips. They were fantastic and stayed moist for days! Next time I plan to add mini peanut butter cups. Yummy!!
One word....Yummy!
Just delicious! Doubled it and these turned out amazing! Defiantly making these again.
These were so chewy and had such a great peanut flavor..I believe I ate 1/2 the pan myself . I baked it in a 8x11 pan but believe I will try a sheet pan next time.
Very good will make again. Followed the recipe..

These are definitely chewy and an excellent brownie base. I added chocolate chips to the top. They could use a lot more peanut butter flavor, it‚Äôs very mild. Maybe adding Reese‚Äôs pieces would give it the extra peanut butter kick it needs!

I followed the recipe ingredients as listed but I chose not to beat the eggs as some of the reviewers recommended. The texture as well as the flavor came out great. I baked mine in a 9x9 square nonstick pan and it was the perfect thickness. I will definitely make this recipe again since not only is it delicious but super easy to make. Next time, I will decorate it with some melted chocolate drizzled on top to make it look and taste even better!
I made these brownies, I added a extra 1/2 cup of peanut butter and extra 1\4 cup of brown sugar.and 1/2 cup of peanut butter chips.They turned out so moist and chewy! My family loved them
